presentation_notes.opening: Let me show you what deployment and day-to-day operations actually look like.
presentation_notes.deployment_section: [Point to left column] Initial deployment takes 1 to 2 weeks. Step one: Install agents via Helm for Kubernetes, Docker for standalone, or systemd for bare metal. Step two: Configure policies in Git‚ÄîYAML files for filter, transform, route logic. Test in staging, then deploy via GitOps with ArgoCD or Flux. Step three: Run in shadow mode for validation. Agents observe but don't modify data. You collect metrics on what WOULD be filtered, compare against query patterns, validate reduction estimates. This takes 1 to 2 weeks. Step four: Go live. Flip from shadow to active mode. Start with non-critical data sources. Do a gradual rollout‚Äîcanary deployment. Monitor for 72 hours before full rollout.
presentation_notes.day2_section: [Point to right column] Day 2 operations‚Äîwhat teams actually do in production. Monitoring and alerting: Pre-built Grafana dashboards show throughput, latency, drop rates. Prometheus metrics exported automatically. Alerts for agent down, high latency, buffer full. Integration with PagerDuty, Slack, Opsgenie. Policy updates: Edit YAML in Git, automatic deployment. A/B testing: route 10% to new policy, 90% to old. Rollback in seconds with git revert. Policy version history for audit. Troubleshooting: Structured logs to your log aggregator. Trace IDs for end-to-end debugging. Shadow replay lets you re-test policies with historical data. Built-in diagnostics endpoints. Capacity planning: Monitor CPU and memory per agent. Scale horizontally by adding more agents. Auto-scaling in Kubernetes based on throughput. No vertical scaling needed‚Äîagents are stateless. Upgrades and maintenance: Rolling updates with zero downtime. Quarterly releases that are backward compatible. Emergency patches within 24 hours. No maintenance window required.
presentation_notes.operational_emphasis: The key point: This is designed to fit into DevOps and SRE workflows teams already know. GitOps, Prometheus, Grafana, PagerDuty. No new tooling required.
presentation_notes.when_to_use: Use this slide when DevOps, SRE, or platform engineering teams ask about operational model
